description: Country - Geographic location.
source: Our World in Data - Regions (2024)

description: Year - Year of observation.
source: Our World in Data - Regions (2024)

description: ISO code - ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 three-letter country codes.
source: International Organization for Standardization - Regions (2023)

description: Population - Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2100, based on data and estimates from different sources.
source: Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

description: Gross domestic product (GDP) - Total economic output of a country or region per year. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.
source: Bolt and van Zanden - Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

description: Continent - geographic location
source: Created according to the UN classification (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/)

description: Sub-region - geographic location
source: Created according to the UN classification (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/)

description: Total electricity generation per person - Measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

description: Primary energy consumption per capita - Measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
source: U.S. Energy Information Administration - International Energy Data (2025) [https://www.eia.gov/opendata/bulkfiles.php]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

description: Primary energy consumption per GDP - Measured in kilowatt-hours per international-$.
source: U.S. Energy Information Administration - International Energy Data (2025) [https://www.eia.gov/opendata/bulkfiles.php]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Bolt and van Zanden - Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

description: Biofuel consumption per capita - Measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

description: Electricity generation from bioenergy per person - Measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

description: Annual percentage change in biofuel consumption - Includes biogasoline (such as ethanol) and biodiesel. Volumes have been adjusted for energy content.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

description: Share of electricity generated by bioenergy - Measured as a percentage of total electricity produced in the country or region.
source: Ember - Yearly Electricity Data Europe (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Ember - Yearly Electricity Data (2025) [https://ember-energy.org/data/yearly-electricity-data/]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

description: Share of primary energy consumption that comes from biofuels - Measured as a percentage of the total primary energy.
source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

description: Electricity generation from hydropower per person - Measured in kilowatt-hours per person.

description: Share of electricity generated by hydropower - Measured as a percentage of total electricity produced in the country or region.
